intro: Ferula nuristanica, commonly known as the Nuristanic giant fennel, is a tall herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan and Pakistan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its hollow stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties. Ferula nuristanica is notable for its ecological significance in high-altitude environments.
